title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
820-00239 that does not turn on, no signs of visible damage. 

PPBUS_G3H = 0v

PPDCIN_G3H = 5.2v

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
Diode mode to ground on PPBUS_G3H and coils?

Remove F7000 and check C7050 voltage.

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
"L7410 0.001
L7420 .0L
L7430 .0L"
Are you sure?
All these coils are tied together.

Post U7000 basic voltages: P_IN, AUX_DET, SMC_RST_IN, VDDA/P, SMC_RST*, AUX_OK, A/BMON.

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
L7420, L7430  also 0.001 sorry, was making a bad contact.

PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H = 5.0v
PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR = 5.21v

TBA_AUX_DET = 1.3v
TBA_VDDP = 0.6V
SMC_RST_L = 0v
TBA_VDDA = 0.6V
SMC_AUX_OK = 0V
CHGR_BMON = 0V
CHGR_BMON = 0V

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
What about  SMC_RST_IN  (SMC_4FINGERS_RST)???

Also check diode mode to ground at VDDA/P.

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
SMC_4FINGERS_RST = 0V

Diode Mode
TBA_VDDP 0.028
TBA_VDDA 0.029

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
Looks like bad U7000.

Just in case, remove C7075/7 first.
If still low readings, change U7000.

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
removed C7075/7 no change. 

I realized there's a short on PP3V3_G3H, even after taking  U7000 out

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
Yeah, that's other problem.
You shouldn't have 0.028 anymore on VDDA/P.

You can try to find the short on 3V3_G3H using voltage injection method.

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
Replaced  U7000 

there was a short on CB300, replaced now got 3.3v on  3V3_G3H 

Still no turn on.

PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H = 19v
PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR = 20v 


TBA_AUX_DET = 4.97v
TBA_VDDP = 0v
SMC_RST_L = erratic between 0v and 2.3 v
TBA_VDDA =0v
SMC_AUX_OK = 3.4v
CHGR_BMON = 0v
CHGR_BMON = 0v
SMC_4FINGERS_RST = 0v

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
Check diode mode to ground at VDDA/P.
If no short, resolder/replace U7000.

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
I replaced the chip again:

TBA_AUX_DET = 4.97v
TBA_VDDP = 5.0v
SMC_RST_L = 3.4v
TBA_VDDA = 5.0v
SMC_AUX_OK = 3.4v
CHGR_AMON = 0v
CHGR_BMON = 0v
SMC_4FINGERS_RST = 0v

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message: Do you get correct PPBUS_G3H voltage now?

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message: No,  PPBUS_G3H  is now 0.8v

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
Check SMC_USBC_INT_L level.
Test if board turns on in SMC bypass mode.

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
SMC_USBC_INT_L is 3.3v

No turn on with SMC Bypass

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message: Remove F7000 and check again C7050 voltage.

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message: C7050 is 0v with F7000 disconnected

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
Check resistance over C7020/23.
Also check diode mode to ground at C7050.

Are you sure U7000 has good solders?

title: 820-00239 no turn on.
message:
C7020/23 resistance is 2.6 ohms for both

diode mode to ground at C7050 is 0.500

It is possible  U7000  has gone bad from so much heat, ill have to wait for another one to arrive.
